The Nebraska Department of Education, Nutrition Services, has informed the Nebraska Schools that the USDA has issued a nationwide waiver to allow us to provide FREE meals to all PK-12 students currently enrolled in school. We have been notified that a waiver is in effect as of September 1st. Student meal accounts will be reviewed and credited for breakfast and lunch meals purchased since September 1st. Any a la carte items, including extra milk and seconds at lunch, purchased since that date and moving forward will still need to be paid for by families. Meals purchased during the month of August are not included in the current waiver. The USDA waiver for FREE meals for all PK-12 students is currently scheduled to end effective December 31, 2020, or until funds are depleted.

If you have any questions, please contact April Brabec at aprilbrabec@leigh.esu7.org

Parent-Teacher conferences are next Tuesday, March 3rd, from 5:00-8:00. Elementary teachers will be in their classrooms with high school staff in the gym. School is dismissed at 2:00 on Tuesday.

For parents of students currently in grades 8-11, we are offering informational meetings on scheduling for next year's classes. Mrs. Karen Hillen will lead these sessions in the Elementary Art (currently Music) Room. The meeting at 5:30 will focus on those in grades 8 and 9 while the meeting at 6:30 is aimed towards those in grades 10 and 11. However, parents may go to either session depending on what works better with their schedule.

Unfortunately, we will not be able to provide child care during the conferences this spring as construction has reduced our number of available rooms.
